Coronavirus relief should focus on the pandemic, not the progressive agenda.

Nearly half the bill’s spending won’t even happen until 2022.

It’s a liberal wish list, not a plan to defeat COVID-19.

name: Morgan Griffith
tweet_text: As Members of Congress, we can and must do our jobs without tossing aside the Constitution. The United States House of Representatives should not be a sparsely attended debating society.

name: Morgan Griffith
tweet_text: Citizens should not trust the future of our great Republic to those who demand they be allowed to do their essential jobs while sitting at home in their La-Z-Boy recliner.

name: Morgan Griffith
tweet_text: The House has met and voted several times during the pandemic, as has the Senate. Further, committees have met live in Washington, D.C. This is not a job that can be done just be phoning it in.

name: Morgan Griffith
tweet_text: Allowing vote by proxy opens that door to serious mischief and legislative malfeasance. Gathering in person is essential to the legislative process. It’s how we talk through issues, gather support for bills, and build relationships for effective lawmaking.

name: Morgan Griffith
tweet_text: The Constitution requires a majority of the House to conduct business, a provision George Mason called ‘valuable & necessary.’ The Framers knew that mischief could take place if the House met with less than a majority of its members.

name: Morgan Griffith
tweet_text: The House majority has proposed a change in the rules that defies the Constitution and undermines the House of Representatives as a legislative body.

tweet_text: I am receiving frequent briefings about this outbreak from medical professionals and public health officials. Please check my website (https://t.co/DxAGNU0Hj7), Facebook (https://t.co/2cdOIJC01R), and Twitter (https://t.co/EHsnaNEaNd) for more updates.

name: Morgan Griffith
tweet_text: Symptoms of coronavirus include fever, shortness of breath, and cough. Seek medical attention if you come down with these symptoms and avoid contact with those who have them. Older individuals and those with significant underlying conditions are most at risk.

name: Morgan Griffith
tweet_text: Practicing good hygiene is essential to prevention. Also, consider rearranging large activities and gatherings, and be careful when making travel plans.

name: Morgan Griffith
tweet_text: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) website, https://t.co/VWm6qGSpxn, features many resources on the coronavirus, including information about symptoms, prevention, and testing.

name: Morgan Griffith
tweet_text: VA’s Department of Health currently imposes strict guidelines on their testing, but commercial labs including Quest and LabCorp are available to process tests if they are ordered by a doctor. Most insurers are covering these tests but check with your insurer first to make sure.

name: Morgan Griffith
tweet_text: Testing is a clear concern for many. Last night on a telephone town hall, one of the questions I received involved tests. Testing capacity is growing rapidly.

name: Morgan Griffith
tweet_text: The coronavirus currently poses a public health threat in the United States. Although no cases are presently confirmed in Southwest Virginia, I want to share with you information and resources that will help prepare you and your family to stay healthy.

name: Morgan Griffith
tweet_text:
Simple precautions will help protect you from coronavirus. Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth, wash your hands with soap and water, and avoid contact with people who are sick.

No cases have been confirmed in SWVA at present, but if you feel symptoms, contact your doctor. https://t.co/exSNIi9yeE

Brexit was a choice made by the people of the U.K. exercising their rights as a sovereign nation. As such, it must be respected.

While the economic and political relationship between the U.K. and Europe changes, the Special Relationship between the U.K. and the U.S. endures.
